decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing a combination of cheap and efficient creatures, powerful spells, and disruptive elements to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The strategy revolves around applying early pressure with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Stubborn Denial and Leyline Binding. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury ensures that the deck can close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This Aggro-Affinity deck focuses on quickly ramping up resources on the battlefield through low-cost artifacts like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal, and utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Ornithopter to overwhelm the opponent with threats. By utilizing cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives, this deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while maintaining a strong offensive presence. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble allows for additional card advantage and mana ramp, further solidifying the deck's ability to quickly close out games.

This Esper Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's gameplay, disrupt their strategies, and eventually win through card advantage and efficient removal. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter adds versatility to the deck, allowing for repeated use of powerful instant spells. The deck also features a companion in Kaheera, the Orphanguard, providing additional value and synergy with the rest of the cards.

The deck revolves around using cards like Street Wraith and Shardless Agent to cycle through the deck quickly, while also controlling the board with cards like Force of Negation and Endurance. The goal is to fill up the graveyard with creatures and then use Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once, overwhelming the opponent. With a mix of card draw, control elements, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to set up a big swing turn with Living End to secure victory.

The deck focuses on efficiently and quickly playing artifact creatures and utilizing spells to generate advantage and disrupt the opponent. It aims to flood the board with artifacts, enabling powerful synergies with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Unholy Heat to control the board and protect its key pieces. By leveraging artifacts and efficient spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory through aggressive plays and resource management.

The main concept of this Amulet Titan deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Amulet of Vigor, and Primeval Titan, and then use that mana to tutor for and play powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Mycosynth Gardens. The deck aims to combo off by generating a large amount of mana and casting a Scapeshift spell to search for multiple lands, usually including Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a bunch of Mountains, to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Eldrazi Temples and Utopia Sprawls to get out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Ugin's Labyrinth help to control the battlefield and prevent the opponent from building up strong board presence. Overall, the deck aims to overpower the opponent with massive Eldrazi creatures while controlling the game through various spells and abilities.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, while also having a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off the opponent or clear blockers. The deck focuses on speed and efficiency, utilizing cheap spells and synergy between cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Mishra's Bauble to enable powerful plays. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells and counterspells while also utilizing powerful creatures and planeswalkers to dominate the board. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game until it can secure a win condition. The deck includes a mix of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats to out-value and outlast the opponent, ultimately leading to victory through board control and efficient resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan with various control elements. By utilizing strong creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with powerful spells like Consign to Memory and Solitude, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and control the pace of the game. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Galvanic Discharge helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy and secure the win. Additionally, the companion choice of Obosh, the Preypiercer adds an extra layer of aggression to the deck.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. It utilizes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, alongside burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support and staying power, while Thraben Charm offers versatility. The deck also includes utility lands like Arena of Glory to further enhance its aggressive game plan. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to apply pressure early and maintain it for a swift victory.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting your opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending, you can control the board and neutralize threats, allowing your creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of Ephemerate and Solitude provides backup removal and protection, ensuring that your aggressive strategy can continue uninterrupted. Overall, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver your opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and green ramp spells. It aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly to cast big threats and search for key pieces. The deck utilizes lands that produce multiple mana or allow for additional land drops to accelerate its game plan. It also includes cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact to tutor for specific creatures. The strategy revolves around efficiently ramping into powerful threats and overwhelming the opponent with big plays.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent. It aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Lightning Bolt provide additional direct damage options, while cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls offer card advantage and board presence. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining a fast and aggressive tempo to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate strong combos and ramp up mana quickly. By using cards like Scapeshift and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to search for key lands and set up explosive plays. The inclusion of cards like Arboreal Grazer and Green Sun's Zenith helps to accelerate the deck's game plan, while also providing flexibility in finding key pieces. The deck also includes utility lands like Vesuva and Lotus Field to further enhance its strategy. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and lands.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while using cards like Voice of Victory and Galvanic Discharge to control the board. The deck also utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer for additional value and card advantage. Additionally, cards like Goblin Bombardment and Arena of Glory provide additional ways to close out the game quickly and efficiently. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities.
